summary.overall_findings: Based on 15 publicly available sources, Macy's public disclosures present evidence at both the operational and policy levels across 5 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars. At the operational level, transparency materials discuss enhanced disclosures in expense and financial reporting, and governance reports mention the use of algorithms for valuation, specifically Monte Carlo simulation for TSR ranking. Fairness practices are documented in one source, and policy-level privacy materials note the use of data for customer engagement. External accountability is also addressed through policies, with news articles detailing a lawsuit alleging data sharing with an AI vendor. No qualifying public evidence was found for explainability or oversight.
